intro: Cistus berthelotianus var. symphytifolius, commonly known as the rock rose, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of fragrant, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and is drought-tolerant. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae and is often found in coastal and mountainous areas. Its aromatic foliage and showy flowers make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
